summary: An FBI Laboratory report from September 2020 detailing the results of questioned document examinations related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. The report indicates that handwriting comparisons between a greeting card and envelope addressed to 'Larry Nassar' and purported known writing of Jeffrey Epstein could not be conducted due to insufficient comparable known writing. The report also notes the presence of indented writing of unknown value on some submitted documents.

persons.context: The individual to whom the questioned greeting card (Item 5) and envelope (Item 4) were addressed.

locations: FBI Laboratory, 2501 Investigation Parkway, Quantico, Virginia
4940 Fowler Road, Redstone Arsenal, Huntsville, Alabama
keyFacts: The FBI Laboratory attempted to compare handwriting on a greeting card and envelope addressed to 'Larry Nassar' against purported known writing of Jeffrey Epstein.
The examination was inconclusive; meaningful comparisons could not be conducted due to a lack of verified, comparable known writing from Epstein.
Indented writing of unknown value was observed on pages within the submitted documents (Item 3), which included pages beginning with the names 'Donald' and 'Jhonny Contreras'.
The report is dated September 9, 2020, indicating ongoing forensic investigation into the Epstein case after his death.
The document reveals a forensic investigative link between the Jeffrey Epstein case and Larry Nassar, the convicted former USA Gymnastics team doctor.
